TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesdays: The Temporary "First Contract Edition" Thread

Articles.Content:
Can't wait till the 64-bit comes out.Till then i just going to say

"64 64 have you hear ,64 64 yes I have ksp in 64-bit."(imagine the theme of lone ranger playing with it)

Not sure your words line up right but here is an auditory aid.

Edit: oh! it is called the William Tell Overture and was famous long before the Lone Ranger came on the scene .

Edited June 28, 2014 by mcirish3
I hope it is released before the 11. July or my vacation is gone without having the ability to stack mod on mod in the game
Looking excellent you guys! I think after this, you all deserve a week off, not just Felipe. Thanks for all the work guys!

No plans for that at the moment, but let's see how it goes on windows first.

Here's hoping that the 64 bit release for Windows goes so smoothly that attention can be given to the OS X version soon thereafter.

My logical guess is that it will break saves, at least for campaign due to all the extensive changes.

But, but I just made a giant space station. Noooooooooooooooo.

(I do not really mind however, because from what I am hearing, this update is going to be AWESOME!)

Edited June 29, 2014 by pauldbk99

But, but I just made a giant space station. Noooooooooooooooo.

Unless they change the actual parts cfgs (like their Modules or size), I'm pretty sure it'll be safe to just transfer your savegame over. Budgets and contracts and everything would, I assume, only effect new games and launches. You've already done the hard work in getting it up there, it won't cost you anything to keep it there. Whether you'll have enough money to visit it though, that's a different question

Can anyone tell me historically roughly how long the experimental stage takes? I'm not going to hold anyone to it, but I'm doing a little planning on a new game so if it's going to be a few weeks, vs a few months I'm gonna wait.

Can anyone tell me historically roughly how long the experimental stage takes? I'm not going to hold anyone to it, but I'm doing a little planning on a new game so if it's going to be a few weeks, vs a few months I'm gonna wait.

I'm not an expert but I think it's usually about 2 weeks.

Depends on the amount of new code. This is a VERY big update with a lot of new code and content, and it might take a while to beat it into shape.

tl/dr: Don't hold your breath!

Depends on the amount of new code. This is a VERY big update with a lot of new code and content, and it might take a while to beat it into shape.

tl/dr: Don't hold your breath!

I undestand that, it's why I said "rough" estimate. Just looking for something based on historical releases for those who have been here for a while. I know this is a much bigger patch than historical but it would give me an idea.
Like someone else said, about 2+ weeks

We'll see a milestone post when 0.24 moves from Experimentals to QA

Then further along in QA we'll also see the media team releasing videos and doing a few Twitch streams with late-QA/early-RC builds

We'll see a milestone post when 0.24 moves from Experimentals to QA

Then further along in QA we'll also see the media team releasing videos and doing a few Twitch streams with late-QA/early-RC builds

greate, 2 weeks vacation without KSP

We'll see a milestone post when 0.24 moves from Experimentals to QA

Then further along in QA we'll also see the media team releasing videos and doing a few Twitch streams with late-QA/early-RC builds

As far as I know, Experimentals are the last phase before the release. IMO we're not getting videos yet due to the bitter experience with 0.23.5 being withheld by a few weeks due to bugs found during experimentals after all videos and coverage was released, but at that phase QA should be already over.

greate, 2 weeks vacation without new version of KSP

Fixed your post. The current version is till working just fine, try it

As far as I know, Experimentals are the last phase before the release. IMO we're not getting videos yet due to the bitter experience with 0.23.5 being withheld by a few weeks due to bugs found during experimentals after all videos and coverage was released, but at that phase QA should be already over.

so maybe in time for this weekend? speculate please

As far as I know, Experimentals are the last phase before the release. IMO we're not getting videos yet due to the bitter experience with 0.23.5 being withheld by a few weeks due to bugs found during experimentals after all videos and coverage was released, but at that phase QA should be already over.

I haven't been around for many releases, but all the videos for .23.5 were released when that update was [internally] scheduled to come out (at least that's how I understood what happened) and then there were some bugs found that made them hold it back at the last minute. So I don't think it's so much they hold back on the videos b/c of that experience but more they generally don't release videos until it's out (or imminently going to be released) anyway.

so maybe in time for this weekend? speculate please

I wouldn't bet on this weekend (and they usually come out on Tuesdays I think). KSPTV usually does some sort of marathon for the release, and I haven't seen anything about that yet, and I seem to remember them saying they would probably do it again for .24, so I would say look out for that as a clue on when they HOPE to get it out. But I'd say July 8th at the earliest, I'd say July 15th is when we pass the line of "maybe" to "likely," barring major bugs.

so maybe in time for this weekend? speculate please

Squad has said many times that they won't release just before a weekend so if not today - Wednesday then probably Monday next week at earliest.
My money's on the 29th July.

My money's on the 29th July.

Even with with the week delay, the ARM update didn't take that long to come out once it hit experimentals. Looking back at past devnotes, They were in QA in the March 11th update, and were in experimentals by March 18th. That means even with the delay, ARM took about two, and at most three, weeks to come out (April 1st).

I've been conservative about my expectations on this one because it is a significant update, but I think a over a month wait is a bit pessimistic.

Well, originally, I was going to say 22nd, but as you said, it's a significant update. I would've said 25th or so, but it's not a Tuesday, and 29th gives them enough leeway in case we get a repeat of ARM hype.
QA happens before Experimentals. I really hope we have this before the long USA Independence Day weekend!

Fixed your post. The current version is till working just fine, try it

Thanks but the current Version is no longer compatible with my list of installed mods, habing a single Launch is not really enjoyable.

While it's no longer practical for Squad or the KSP devs, I enjoyed Ye Olde Tymes when releases would be sudden and out of the blue. They were a happy, wonderful surprises that would appear from nowhere like a good gift.

While it's no longer practical for Squad or the KSP devs, I enjoyed Ye Olde Tymes when releases would be sudden and out of the blue. They were a happy, wonderful surprises that would appear from nowhere like a good gift.

Yeah, but those releases were single-digit weeks apart, not 6 months
